api package

Submodules

api.error_handling module

api.error_handling.abort_if_does_not_exist(key, data)

throws a curl status error if a given key does not exist in a dictionary

Parameters

  • key (str) – key into data

  • data (dict) – dictionary of api data

api.error_handling.abort_if_operation_unsupported(operation, name)

throws a curl status error if a given operation cannot be applied to the calling resource

Parameters

  • operation (str) – curl operation name

  • name (str) – url path to the calling resource

api.resource_factory module

class api.resource_factory.ResourceFactory

Bases: object

classmethod make_resources(*, template_data, required_fields=[])

generates resources based on template_data and returns them

Parameters

  • template_data (dict) – data to convert into resources

  • required_fields (dict) – fields required for POST requests

Returns

list of dictionaries of resource classes and urls

Return type

list

api.resource_factory.make_dict_layer_resource(*, template_data, data, resources, key_chain, required_fields)

generates resource for a dictionary layer in template_data, then calls make_resources_per_layer to continue generating resources

Parameters

  • template_data (dict) – data to convert into resources

  • data (dict) – full data dictonary

  • resources (list) – list of resources to append to

  • key_chain (list) – chain of keys so far to form url path for resource

  • required_fields (dict) – fields required for POST requests

api.resource_factory.make_list_layer_resource(*, template_data, data, resources, key_chain, required_fields)

generates resource for a list layer in template_data, then calls make_resources_per_layer to continue generating resources

Parameters

  • template_data (list) – data to convert into a resource

  • data (dict) – full data dictonary for the api

  • resources (list) – list of resources to append to

  • key_chain (list) – chain of keys so far to form url path for resource

  • required_fields (dict) – fields required for POST requests

api.resource_factory.make_resources_per_layer(*, template_data, data, resources, key_chain=[], required_fields=[])

recursively generates resources by parsing template_data and appends them to resources

Parameters

  • template_data (dict) – data to convert into resources

  • data (dict) – full data dictonary for the api

  • resources (list) – list of resources to append to

  • key_chain (list) – chain of keys so far to form url path for resource

  • required_fields (dict) – fields required for POST requests

  • class_def (type) – the original class definition
